Description:
The DiagnosticReport FHIR resource contains information about a single diagnostic service performed for a patient. Supported diagnostic services include laboratory, radiology, and cardiology. Within DiagnosticReport, the Observation FHIR resource returns individual components from laboratory tests and text-based content, such as narratives or impressions, from radiology and cardiology results.

The DiagnosticReport resource corresponds to the following Common Clinical Data Set (CCDS) Elements: Laboratory Tests.

The Search interaction enables the client to query for all diagnostic reports that have been filed for a given patient. The client, having established the patient in question, now wishes to retrieve all documented test level result data for the patient, and can further refine the search to specify a date or a LOINC code for the DiagnosticReport resources in question.

Note: Some healthcare activities could be classified as either a diagnostic service or a procedure (e.g. endoscopic procedures, biopsies, etc.).  Individual health systems can define which activities they classify for the Procedure vs. DiagnosticReport resource.  As a result, you may see some procedures returned as a DiagnosticReport resource at some health systems, but as a Procedure resource at others.

Remarks: Text based result content, such as narratives, impressions, or addendums, will be represented as related Observations rather than in the text element inherited by DomainResource. If the results from a Search return medication orders, an error will be returned for those orders.

code.Name: code
code.Description:
The code for the report as a whole, as opposed to codes for the atomic results, which are the names on the observation resource referred to from the result.
  • Starting in the November 2021 version of Epic, or the August 2021 version with special updates, this can be any code type associated with the procedures, including LOINC, CPT, SNOMED, or other code types mapped to a procedure in Epic.
  • In earlier versions, this can only be a LOINC code.

date.Name: date
date.Description: The date or date range the order was resulted.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: The subject of the report if it is a patient.
patient.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The subject of the report if it is a patient.
subject.Optional: Either patient or subject must be provided. If both are provided, they must reference the same patient.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

entry.Name: entry
entry.Description: A single DiagnosticReport returned from the search.

resource.Name: resource
resource.Description: A single resource returned as part of this bundle.

DiagnosticReport.Name: DiagnosticReport
DiagnosticReport.Description: An instance of the STU3 DiagnosticReport resource.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The Name/Code for this diagnostic report.

context.Name: context
context.Description:
Encounter when the test was ordered.

This will be either a FHIR Encounter reference in the encounter.reference element, or an encounter CSN identifier in the encounter.identifier element.

effectiveDateTime.Name: effectiveDateTime
effectiveDateTime.Description: Clinically relevant time/time period for report.

system.Name: system
system.Description: The namespace for the identifier value.

issued.Name: issued
issued.Description:
DateTime this version was released.

Available starting in the February 2022 version of Epic and in the November 2021 version with special update.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: Participants in producing the report. This is always a reference to the Practitioner resource.

result.Name: result
result.Description: Observations, simple or complex nested groups.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the report. You can find the list of values here: http://hl7.org/fhir/diagnostic-report-status.
